directions.step:
From: MarkandSue@highland.cix.co.uk (Mark and Sue Thomas)
These are a bit like Danish Pastries but without the yeast dough. You can use either filling or both together. Cut pastry into 16 squares, 3" by 3". On each square, cut in diagonally from each corner, leaving an area in the centre that is uncut, about 1 inch across. Put a teaspoonful of either or both fillings in the centre. Take one corner and fold it to the middle. Move to the next triangle, and fold in one corner. Do this for each of the 4 triangles, so you have a pinwheel shape. Four corners meet in the middle on top of the apple, and 4 are left flat. This is easier to do than to explain! Use a fish slice to lift onto a greased or lined tray, and paint with milk or egg and milk if you have any. Bake at 190 C, 375 F for 20 minutes until the points are golden brown. To make custard: Mix all together and either microwave for 2 minutes, stirring occasionally, or cook over a low heat in a saucepan until thickened. It will taste a bit raw at this stage, but will be fine after baking.
Recipe by: Sue Thomas
